<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tracing Sigil](/Feats.aspx?ID=3374) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 123</row>

**Archetype** [Spell Trickster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=126)

**Prerequisites**
[Spell Trickster Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3368); ability to cast [_sigil_](/Spells.aspx?ID=286)

</column>

---

When you cast _sigil_, you can modify the spell to add the following to its standard effects: The target leaves a magical trail that you and others can try to follow. You and other creatures can attempt to [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) the target, substituting an [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11), or [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) check (whichever matches the magical tradition of your sigil spell) for the [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) check. Much like Tracking with Survival, this must take place somewhere the target has been and follow the trail; it doesn't allow anyone to find the target from a distance. You can only have a single target marked with a modified sigil in this way. If you use this ability again on a second target, the _sigil_ spell on the first target ends, and your mark fades.

<title level="2">Tracing Sigil leads to...</title>
[Beacon Mark](/Feats.aspx?ID=3383)
